name: Lil' Walker
description: Journey your way high and low, far and wide, just for the heck of it. Meet weirdos along the way. Explode things. Explode them good. It's a super quirky semi-retro platform-adventure.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Something old should be fine. Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: N/A DirectX: Version 9.0 Storage: 18 MB available space Sound Card: N/A

reviews.review_text: It's alright.  The First Level's Difficulty is fine, but what I though were the checkpoints didn't let me respawn when I lost my health, but they always brought me back when I fell so I don't know if the checkpoints are confused about what they're meant to do or if they only let you respawn on falling down a pit.  But it's a pretty fun game and I wanted to keep going through the level every time I ended up dying.  Graphics are Really nice and pixely and they sit well with me.  Overall I'd recommend it, it's a pretty fun game and for 4 dollars, it's enough to keep your attention for a little while.  However I recommend d-pad mode, the normal mode the game was made with in mind is highly boring and is really not a good mode to start with if your just starting the game.
I really liked the game's art and animation. I also enjoyed the jokes and references throughout. Well done.
